answers.answer: Hi....since u gave birth such a short time ago, have u had ur labs done?...pregnancy can affect the thyroid....u may also want to have ur vitamin and mineral levels checked...low levels of magnessium and potassium can cause some of the symptoms u mentioned.did u think it was the Mirena causing a problem, since u had it removed after 5 months?I know nothing of the item or side effects.I was recently dx with a thyroid issue and put on 40 lbs in 6 months!!....  : (I am not a dr...just like u looking for answers.keep us posted!Good luckGodspeed"selma"
Could be meds side effects , ask your doctor if they could have these symptoms
Thanks, I have 2 doc appts scheduled next week so hopefully I will get some answers....it's the waiting that's the worst!

diabetes can cause pins and needles from neuropathy (nerve damage).  along with thyroid, make sure they check your blood sugar.  hope you get an answer...i know that pins and needles feeling is annoyuing...as a matter of fact, th eleft side of my face is doing it right now and i hate it!!

question: Hello.  First a little history...I am a 33 year old woman in pretty good health - no major problems in my medical history (however I am overweight).  I gave birth to triplets 8 and a half months ago.  About 6 months ago I started taking Zoloft.  I also had Mirena inserted about 5 months ago and removed a couple of weeks ago.Starting about 2 months ago I started to have a lot of tingling sensations (like pins and needles) in my hands and feet.  The most disturbing tingling was in my abdomen (almost felt like I was wearing a girdle on the inside).  The tingling in my hands and feet is there all the time and I also have radiating numbness from my hips to my feet.  On top of that I m having trouble with my short term memory (for example I'll start a task at work and forget what I was doing), I'm having problems focusing, and I have gained 25 pounds in the last 2 months (all the while trying to LOSE weight - exercising and eating pretty well).  I am very concerned and of course worst case scenarios have started playing in my head.  Can you give me your opinion on what the issue(s) might be?Thank you very much.
title: Nervous about several different symptoms
